title: following provisions of the Online Safety and Media Regulation Act 2022 (No.
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Online Safety and Media Regulation Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Online Safety and Media Regulation Act 

2022 (Commencement) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited online safety medium regulation act 2022 (commencement) order 2023

title: following provisions of the Online Safety and Media Regulation Act 2022 (No.
heading: 2. The 15th day of March 2023 is appointed as the day on which the
text_raw:
2. The 15th day of March 2023 is appointed as the day on which the 
following provisions of the Online Safety and Media Regulation Act 2022 (No. 
41 of 2022) shall come into operation: 

(a) Parts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8, 

(b) Part 9 (other than sections 36 and 40), 

(c) Parts 10, 11, and 12 (other than section 47 in so far as Part 8B of 
the Broadcasting Act 2009 as inserted by section 47 relates to a 
failure to comply with section 128B(1) or (2), or any rules made 
under section 128C, of that Act), 

(d) 

sections 50 and 52(a), 

(e) Parts 14, 15, and 16, and 

(f) Part 17 (other than section 74). 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 February, 2023. 

CATHERINE MARTIN, 

Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and 
Media. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th February, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [71] 3
